website_summaries.verdict: A great computer fan option designed for heavy use in gaming computers.
pros: Premium plastic materials are durable enough to be used for consistent use
Fan blade design keeps airflow running quietly, decreasing the overall noise
Pushes out a significant amount of air
cons: Not large enough to use as a primary fan in some cases

customer_reviews.title: Shhhhhh....
customer_reviews.text: In the morning or when it's quiet in the house, I came to really notice how much my PC fan was throttling up and down and, over time, it really got to bug me. I replaced my stock PC fan today with the Noctua and all I hear is nothing - sweet silence. Had to remove the brown corner pads on one half to fit the snap in Dell design but easily done. If you're a geek like me, check out the Noctua website. You'll get a great background in understanding how and why their fans are so quiet. Little more money - a lot more quiet. Very Pleased !
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: Check your board
customer_reviews.text: Not compatible with many HP, Dell and other motherboards, nowhere does it state that on the falsely created ad. The fans will NOT work on my board under any circumstances aside from using a patch cable and making them just steady on fans, which is of no use. Check with Noctua for compatibility before purchase. They also make a bad noise when not used on 4pin headers for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: SardonickTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: All the online review I read called this an excellent fan, and I must agree. It keep my case cooler than the old fan, is definitely quieter, and looks and feels like a quality product. It comes with a 4-pin connector, so my motherboard can control the speed (that's what PWM means). It generally runs at about medium speed (1800 rpm), but my making a special effort to load up my system, I can get it step up to 2200 rpm- and it's still silent. In fact, it's so quiet (compared to my old Cooler Master) that I got out a flashlight and crawled under the desk to make sure it was actually running!
customer_reviews.author: Allen Driskill

customer_reviews.title: I'm a... fan
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the ugliest consumer products that people just LOVE. So when I had to replace some completely hidden fans deep inside my parent's prebuilt, I got one of these. The construction on these is just amazing. I mean, I'm blown away. It's like fan art. And things run the risk of looking gimmicky, but then you read the reviews and it seems that the construction detail actually does convert to performance. So, I get it now. I'll never place one where it can be seen. But I'll try to hide as many as I can.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: Used for a 50 watt LED heatsink
customer_reviews.text: I have a 50 watt grow light in my living room and the original fan was too loud. I searched "quite fans" and found this. I didn't realize how loud the 1st fan was until I got this and could compare thsm. It has 2 speed settings and both of them are ridiculously quiet. Considering how cheap they are you can't go wrong. I don't think it's just the rubber mounting attachments that are on the fan, but the fan itself is just really quiet. I am using 2 of them for LEDS and neither one is housed in any enclosure that would dampen the sound. They are both open, visible and super quiet. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Groovydogg

customer_reviews.title: Good buy to replace old case fan
customer_reviews.text: My old case fan was getting noisy so I decided to use this Noctua to replace it. I used the rubber pull-through mounts supplied with the fan. As well as I can tell, it's nearly silent and the Gigabyte app that controls temperature and fans for my motherboard and CPU shows everything is staying cool. The mounting options that come with this fan are impressive for the flexibility they allow - good move by the manufacturer. I'm very satisfied! If/when the fan on my CPU cooler gets noisy, I'll buy a cooler from Noctua. The reviews look very good. .
customer_reviews.author: Don Shipp

customer_reviews.title: Connection is NOT Compatible With DELL MB Fan Header. My oversight.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and includes several different cable lengths. Just doesn't plug into my DELL MB fan header. My oversight. I have had twp DELL PCs and know most DELL PCs use proprietary components. The thing that really torques my hind side is that the ONLY adaptor I have found to enable me to use the Noctua case fan costs as much as I paid for the fan. If I want to use the Noctua fan,I am going to have to find an adaptor, and I can tell you they are scarce. Bah Humbug DELL
customer_reviews.author: HosteenHoskieBegay

customer_reviews.title: This is a premium fan
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to imagine a fan being more premium. Everything about it screams quality. The box it comes in, the many accessories (screws, fan extension cables, fan splitters, resistive low speed adapters, etc). Once you get the fans out of the box, they are sturdy, high density. You don't have to imagine how they can offer a 6 year warranty with these fans. They look and feel like they will last much much longer than that. I just wonder about that color scheme though. What were they thinking?
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T. Karlsson

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and inefficient.
customer_reviews.text: Of three fans that I compared, this was the noisiest and least efficient (more current and less air) than the other two. It did come with several cables and mounting accessories that I didn't use.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Brown and Beige
customer_reviews.text: It hasn't died or started squeaking, chirping or making any unusual noise. It runs relatively quiet for the expected amount of airflow. It does have onboard RPM sensors. Made a little bit of electrical interference noise running PWM, but works fine in DC. Chocolate Brown and Beige doesn't exactly match the black PCB and interior of my case, but may look right at home in your 80's performance build with a 5.5" Floppy. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Good Solid fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought a set of these to put into my Thermaltake Core V1 build. They are extremely quiet fans. The only thing that I honestly don't like about them is the look. That brown color really isn't that good to look at. I probably will end up swapping them out for some Chromax one, once they make them or I might go to a different brand all together. The fans themselves are great, just the overall look, not the greatest.
customer_reviews.author: Vedran Simic

customer_reviews.title: Great for the size, like I knew Noctua would be.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't pull a ton of air, even at max speed, but it's an 80mm fan. The rubber corners tend to slip and slide all over the place when installing them, but it's a one-time inconvenience I can deal with. Comes with an extension cable, a noise reducing cable (i.e. speed reducing cable), and a PWM Y-cable. I wish I knew the last part, since I bought additional Y-cables for nothing. Oh well, I'll use them somewhere. Surprised that the fans come with so many cable additions, and they're fantastic quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas K.

customer_reviews.title: Good Fan For the Price, But Definitely Needs Real Screws
customer_reviews.text: The fan definitely accomplishes the job for my Syber Vapor E-Gaming PC, although the "screws" it came with were completely useless and I had to use the heatsink that was already presently in my fan that I was replacing. In fact, that was the most challenging issue as I had to use my own screws which didn't look pretty and resulted in having to break the edges of my previous fan just to use those screws, but got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond K.

customer_reviews.title: Don't need no stinking RGB.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 for some extra cooling to the hard drive area of the Cooler Master HAF XB. I guess they're working and quiet. Can't hear them over the battery backup in the same rack as the computer. I'm glad the fans are on the inside of the machine and on the back of it because like every other Noctua fan, they're ugly as sin. Came well-packaged and with multiple different connectors/extensions and mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: It's a Noctua!  It's great
customer_reviews.text: I needed an 80mm case fan for a 2U rack mount case. 80mm fans tends to be loud, but this one was definitely quieter but still pumped the air needed to cool the components. Wherever I can, I buy Noctua fans. I don't care for the color, so I would prefer they not be fans used in visible spots, and they do have a grey/black version (Redux) but it's less powerful. I would buy this fan again for case needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: I'm using 2 of these fans in my front to pull cool air into the case and they are doing an excellent job keeping the airflow moving and the internal components (especially my GFX) cool. So far I'm a new but HUGE fan of Noctua and believe they are the only company I'll be using for future cooling purchases. All of the recent fans (cpu cooler, 120mm, and 80mm) have been through Noctua for the efficiency of airflow and low noise they provided (none are using the provided low noise adapters as I haven't seen the need to use them).
customer_reviews.author: Bertlor

customer_reviews.title: Great little fan
customer_reviews.text: good little fan, for the amount of air it pushes I never would have guessed it was only 80mm. It's a really good fan that sits on the outside of my case and is near silent. In fact at 80% power I hear my quiet GPU fans over this fan. Very impressed. I have this installed in mini iTX setup, so noise is very apparent and this fan does not make any
customer_reviews.author: Sm 620

customer_reviews.title: So I bought this one because I've been reading about how great noctua is
customer_reviews.text: My recently bought enermax 80mm fan was rattling and making buzzing noises even at low rpms. So I bought this one because I've been reading about how great noctua is... Noctua definitely lives up to its reputation. No buzzing, electrical noises. Good airflow. Extremely quiet, it has a slight wind noise but that's it. It's crazy how quiet my room is now. My hdd is now the loudest thing in my case when I'm not gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Tho Pho

customer_reviews.title: Best Fans Available
customer_reviews.text: I put these in the back wall of a 4U Supermicro 846 chassis and they are quieter at full tilt than the stock fans ramped down. To make up for the lack of air flow I have three 140mm Noctua industrial fans installed on the front. I can now sit three feet away and not need ear plugs. These fans are known as the best for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: In2quads

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Silent!
customer_reviews.text: I literally cannot hear them. I bought two of these to replace the fans that came in a computer case (Antec ISK 300-150) for a build I was doing. The stock fans were actually quite noticeable even at idle! These Noctua fans are dead silent. I have them plugged into the motherboard for speed control, and even with the computer under load I can't hear these fans. They're kind of on the expensive side, but if you like silence they're definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement fan for IC-7300
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the fan in an Icom IC-7300 HF radio. Was easy to do (thank you, YouTube) and works quite the treat. I keep an eye on my radio's temp while sending. But so far, even though it moves less CFM, been well pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Skip, W5UTWTop Contributor: Ham Radio

customer_reviews.title: It ain't pretty it gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I recently started hearing a fan whine coming from my cpu cooler fan. Being since it's a old Dell xps 8700 with a i7 4790. I didnt want to buy a cpu cooler for it since it's never given me a heat issue. I was already planning to clean out the old thermal paste on it and decided to purchase this. I had already swapped out the rear fan about 2 years back with a noctua 92mm fan to help with the noise and improve thermals. Happy to say you dont hear it at all and noticing my cpu idling a little bit cooler with the stock heatsink attached.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Will buy Noctua in the future
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is a tiny beast. Installed on a side panel directly above my Ryzen 1600 and it dropped 5 degrees while idle and 8 under load using the Wraith Spire. Mostly quiet operation. Construction feels solid. Noctua, I love and am using the included accessories. I put the low-noise adapter on a 3-pin fan that sounded like a jet turbine. Life is good now. Gracias.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb P.

customer_reviews.title: Whisper Quiet & Moves A Lot Of Air
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan to replace the noisier one on my Icom 7300 amateure radio. Fits perfectly and very quietly moves a lot of air. My 7300 stays cooler, which in amateur radio, is what it is all about. NOCTUA is a good company to do business with. Delivery was fast and item was as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Sam The Sham

customer_reviews.title: i was expecting better for the price
customer_reviews.text: + very powerful + has rubberized mount holes - not silent on high rpm, makes noise depending on orientation in space - i can feel it vibrate in my hand => it's unbalanced - expensive Overall, I would choose Arctic over this
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: You don't know what you are missing until you try this fan.
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it short: my computer's stock fan was so loud, it was making the whole pc tower vibrate and caused a massive amount of noise. I can still remember the vibrations from my legs and arms making contact with the desk. I finally got tired of it and ordered this fan. It took about a minute to install and turn it on and that was that. No more noise. It's like it's not even on. If I hadn't seen the blades spinning, I'd think I got a dud. It also keeps the PC's temperatures far lower than the stock fan. All I can say is that I'll never go back to regular fans. It's that good.
customer_reviews.author: Fabian

customer_reviews.title: So quite, so ugly!
customer_reviews.text: These are as quite as they are ugly and they are really quite! None of the provided mounting hardware worked for my application so be aware you might have to hit the parts bin to make these work.
customer_reviews.author: Lunchbox

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, moves air, worth the price and the colors.
customer_reviews.text: Great fan, replaced the stock 80mm that came on my CPU heatsink. Amazing difference in noise levels and moves plenty of air when the system asks it to. Everyone who is into PCs knows what Noctua fans are, and they are worth their price and their colors to have the best thermal performance for your PC.
customer_reviews.author: Keyan

customer_reviews.title: The best of the best.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best fans in the world for a reason... and even though they are the most hideous PC parts that I've ever seen, I don't think that I'll ever go back. You may want an RGB universe in your chassis - I have one so I know - but these fans (all Noctua fans) are so superior that it makes one contemplate just how much more important the function actually is when viewed over the form. PS - I think Noctua could make an absolute fortune if they started offering RGB Fans or even maybe just pure jet black ones?
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Added airflow
customer_reviews.text: I used this fan to blow air over a 4-HDD RAID in my desktop. It also helps draw in extra fresh air for my CPU. I mounted it to a custom 3D printed frame in the 5.25" bays of my computer case. It works well and definitely moves some air without being too loud.
customer_reviews.author: Reed J

customer_reviews.title: Great and very quiet fans
customer_reviews.text: Great and very quiet fans. I bought tow of these fans to replace older fans. While certainly more expensive I am glad I purchased these fans. They have been very quiet and came with everything I needed to install it in the way of cabling and screws for a variety of situations. Will buy this brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I decided to purchase a few Noctua fans for my new PC builds. I was not disappointed. I've been building PC's for over 20 years and these are by far the nicest fans I have ever installed. They are ugly IMO but if you can get over the color combo you will not regret purchasing these fans. They are packaged better than any other fan and they are dead quiet. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: David Bugnon

customer_reviews.title: Used to replace fan on IC-7300
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the stock fan on my ICOM IC-7300 transceiver and it is much quieter. The unit moves more than enough air to keep my rig cool during long transmissions at full power. Exact details for making the change-out are available on the web.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of these to replace the cheap fans ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to replace the cheap fans in my rackmount case. Not only are these Noctua fans well engineered and designed they are dead quiet. I used the rubber mounting grommets that are shipped as an install option in lieu of the metal screws. This really helps reduce any vibration noise on the case. Noctua products are simply hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lewellen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and quiet
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and i am an 65 year old with arthritic hands! They had different hardware depending on your need. Works great and not noisy. My desk top cabinet is right next to my recliner. I never hear it.
customer_reviews.author: becky WI

customer_reviews.title: Most Well Built and Quietest Fans You'll Ever Buy
customer_reviews.text: The are some of the nicest and quietest fans I've ever seen/used. The material is rubber coated to help with vibration. It includes rubber stoppers which can keep the fan away from metal frames. It has an assortment of adapters to make the cords lengths longer if needed. The fan is so quiet you don't even know they are running. This is a must have for people who care about silent PC systems.
customer_reviews.author: notap

customer_reviews.title: They're Noctua..what do you expect?
customer_reviews.text: Can you get past the ugly brown and tan color? Good. Because these fans are whisper quiet and provide a great amount of airflow. I added these to my Rosewill LSV-4412 Hot swap case because the fans included with that case were sub-par. However, these fans brought my case temps down ~5C and they don't add any noticeable noise to my server case. Highly recommend Noctua to anyone who wants professional fans that work great...despite the color
customer_reviews.author: Schwiing

customer_reviews.title: good fans but they can be a nighmare to install.
customer_reviews.text: I would upgrade the "Easy to install rating" from a two star to 4 star if they included one or two spare vibration silicone mounting pegs that can start to brake if you pull too hard. It's hard to fully snap fans on which a bear when mounting them to a case. Fingers hurt and it took me about an half hour to mount two fans to my RSV-L4500 rack mount case. I would also bump up the "value" for the money from 3 to 4 stars if they did include one or two more silicone mounting pegs. With spare pegs you could use a needle nose pliers without worrying too much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, great extras.
customer_reviews.text: I had a weird case that I needed to get these for to replace some noisy stock fans, the extra kit you get with this fan is amazing. You get a y splitter, an extension cable, and a low voltage (silent mode) adapter. And on top of that it is a Noctua fan and the hype surrounding these fans is real.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best, just buy them
customer_reviews.text: Spent over 100 dollars in Noctua fans already. I put that "stuff" on everything... Simply the best, just buy them. They are an ugly shade of brown? When you plug them in you will understand and completely ignore this fact, I guarantee it.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Noctua makes quiet fans!
customer_reviews.text: My computer chassis came with a very cheap and loud three pin fan. When I built the computer I decided to upgrade it and what a difference. This thing is super quiet and since it is a 4 pin I have more control over its function in the BIOS. Color isn't a problem for me since I can't see it on the back of the computer. Great upgrade for me. I also have the Noctua Low-Profile Quiet CPU Cooler for Intel 115x Based Retail Cooling NH-L9I and they go together well. Love this brand!
customer_reviews.author: DM3

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, cools lwell
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this fan to replace a noisy stock fan. I was very impressed by the results. The fan is completely inaudible over other case noises, and judging by my temperatures, is still moving a substantial amount of air over the components. Highly recommend for anyone who is looking for a Quiet fan with a capital "Q".
customer_reviews.author: Hunwise

customer_reviews.title: Great fan. Perfect for my custom build
customer_reviews.text: Great fan. Perfect for my custom build. I used it in a tight spot to feed outside air to the 3 stock fans of my 1080ti. The card has never exceeded 58 degrees C. and my hot m.2 ssd sits right under the intake of the third fan. Very very happy I am.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement for an OEM fan on IC-7300
customer_reviews.text: Excellent replacement for an OEM fan on IC-7300. Almost noiseless. Took a little work (see various websites), but worth the $, work, and time.
customer_reviews.author: JJenkx

customer_reviews.title: Too much packaging
customer_reviews.text: Feels well made, delivers on how quiet it is. Could probably cost half as much if the extra 3 cables I don't need and fancy packaging were optional.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Super Quiet, Good performance
customer_reviews.text: 0 complaints, I personally don't mind the color as a lot of negative reviews on here are about? (why) There is no noticeable noise, using this in a 4U rack mount CPU case.
customer_reviews.author: George H.

customer_reviews.title: super happy of these fans it exhaust all of the ...
customer_reviews.text: super happy of these fans it exhaust all of the hot air from my Corsair 250D and does it without making any noise!! bought two of them!!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to remove the plastic protector from the fan plug ...
customer_reviews.text: rigged this to an old GTS 290 whose fan died. used somewhat heavy duty thread to tie it to the heatsink. It was easy to remove the plastic protector from the fan plug on the board and plug this one in. works well and I have better temps that before (basic daily usage), even after cleaning while still using the old fan.
customer_reviews.author: V&S

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Quiet and Durable Fans
customer_reviews.text: These fans are very well made. They are extremely quiet and durable. I installed them into my 4U server that contains 24 hard drive bays. After switching the fans that came with the case for these the was no more hum. Just extreme quietness. I would recommend these fans to anyone looking for a great quality made fan.
customer_reviews.author: Gaylord Haynes

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet
customer_reviews.text: It's a Noctua... dropped right in as a replacement for the noisy stock CPU fan. Plan to get another to replace the fan in the PSU soon.
customer_reviews.author: tahwos

customer_reviews.title: all the cool kids are using it
customer_reviews.text: zoomj it's the one I saw on youtube It's high-quality and comes with some cool rubber feet for mounting so it doesn't rattle your case. That's it really.
customer_reviews.author: ranix

customer_reviews.title: The best 80mm fan you can buy
customer_reviews.text: As usual Noctua's quality doesn't disappoint. Most 80mm are just simply too weak. The NF-A8 moves air similar to a 120mm fan and its probably because of the max 2200 rpm speed, but it's quiet at high speeds!
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: Good airflow at low noise
customer_reviews.text: Great fan, and very quiet. I am using this as a replacement for a heatsink fan and it is whisper quiet while keeping things well cooled. One note, be careful if trying to use this with Dell (and possibly other OEMs), as Dell uses a thin 5 pin Motherboard connector that you will have to buy an adapter to get this to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, well made, moves some air, just a little spendy.
customer_reviews.text: As 70's/80's as they look with the sexy brown and beige color scheme, these puppies are incredibly high quality, incredibly silent, and move some air. Highly recommended. The rubber bits at the corner to help dampen any vibrations are a thoughtful touch.
customer_reviews.author: J. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet fans and the quiet adapter it comes with is great!
customer_reviews.text: Very low noise fans. The quiet adapter it comes with is really good. I have 5 nested 4 pin PWM fans plugged into the little low noise adapter cable. now all fans are running at 600~ rpm (what i needed). Now I can sleep at night without turning off my server. (This could have been done through BIOS or a fan controller. But, it is still very neat.)
customer_reviews.author: Szwagier

customer_reviews.title: Silent and durable!
customer_reviews.text: I don't remember which one this was for, but I replace all fans on computers etc with Noctua. You can't even hear the equipment in the living room now.
customer_reviews.author: bill

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: High quality, and great for a quiet-server build where airflow is still important. As my other cheap fans start to wear out, I tend to replace them all with Noctua fans. Worth the extra cost; I couldn't be happier with them!
customer_reviews.author: T-Moz

customer_reviews.title: Loved their care they put into packaging and attention to ...
customer_reviews.text: Loved their care they put into packaging and attention to detail. Ordered 2x 80mm fan for my mini itx and it works wonderfully. silent and keeps my case cool as exhaust fans.
customer_reviews.author: tloppa

customer_reviews.title: silent and perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for decades and they simply work, every time, in silence.
customer_reviews.author: CigarObsession

customer_reviews.title: Noctua NF-A8 PWM, Premium Quiet Fan, 4-Pin (80mm, Brown)
customer_reviews.text: Noctua fans are the best for noise these are all I buy when I need a fan
customer_reviews.author: J. Tsuno

customer_reviews.title: Whisper Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Most 80mm fans are noisy, these, like other fans from Noctua, these are whisper quiet.
customer_reviews.author: luisv

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fans
customer_reviews.text: Look nice, rubber padded mounting points. Run quiet. Nice accessories. Extension cable and cable splitter..
customer_reviews.author: Peter Peel

customer_reviews.title: Whisper silent, great airflow, includes mounting gear!
customer_reviews.text: Noctua, I love you. You made a Sandy Bridge Xeon run like its on ice, even with the stock heat sink.
customer_reviews.author: michael hinds

customer_reviews.title: Great fans, very quiet and smooth
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fans... worth every penny over the cheaper chinese made fans
customer_reviews.author: Cryptomined

customer_reviews.title: It's a noctua.. duh, it's great
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a fan, congrats. You've found it. Look no further.
customer_reviews.author: darryl cochrane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Fan
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice fan, super quiet. The price for this fan is a little bit more than most but a really good value for such quality.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and small.
customer_reviews.text: A good replacement of OEM fans, if you want non-vibrating and quiet 80mm fan. The only con is the color palette, but, as it's sort of Noctua's signature, there's nothing you can do about it.
customer_reviews.author: Javid Akhundov

customer_reviews.title: They work very well and are remarkably quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I have used many Noctua Fans over the years. vv I have had a a number in service (80mm and 120mm) ~ 10 years 24/7/365 with NO failures. They are a few more dollars, but WELL worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Miranker

customer_reviews.title: The compactness and power is good and the price is fair but maybe a little ...
customer_reviews.text: The compactness and power is good and the price is fair but maybe a little inflated. I've heard their regional quality can be wanting too so I hope noctua does a better job with that. This fan, however, is pretty quiet as I don't have it in a 4 pin slot.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Fan!
customer_reviews.text: I had installed this fan under my video card inside my full tower case. I am using the fan for exhaust and I have to say the fan is doing its job, that's for sure. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Premium. That basically sums it all up. From packaging to the quality of Noctua's products. You know what you are getting. A little on the higher priced side? Sure. But these fans (even at the 80mm size) are better then any fans I have ever purchased. From Antek to Corsair, I am now a believer in Noctua. 10/10 would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Noel Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly quiet at max RPM. Don't over think it, just get them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Pretty quiet even when running at 100% 2200 rpm.
customer_reviews.text: Noctua fans are no joke. Fans quieter @ 2200rpm than some 140mm @1300rpm. No black version for 80mm fans.
customer_reviews.author: Nossy

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet at full speed
customer_reviews.text: Nice and quiet at full speed just like a Noctue should be. Got 2 for rear exhaust on a Lian Li case.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rusch

customer_reviews.title: Good little fan. 👍
customer_reviews.text: Got this as an upgrade for my Evercool 5.25 drive bay. Moves more air at lower db with and is a better quality build overall. Hard to beat Noctua.
customer_reviews.author: ian long

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: There's not much to be said here. It's a Noctua fan and you buy it because it's a Noctua fan. They run nigh silent and the performance is amazing. I have no qualms and will definitely be choosing Noctua again for my next PC build.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Noctua NF-A8 PWM Fan Better Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised when the two Noctua NF-A8 PWM fans I order arrived. Obviously the product and its packaging were well thought out with the end consumer in mind. Ever bit of hardware I could possibly need to install this very quiet fan was included in the package. The box included various cable configurations, mounting screws and Chromax Anti-Vibration Mounts. I would definitely consider Noctua products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Kibler

customer_reviews.title: Quiet fan with more connectors than I know what to with!
customer_reviews.text: Never had such a quiet fan with so many connctions fittings included.
customer_reviews.author: William Eid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Pleantly surprise to see a conservative spec on noise reduction. The Noctura fan was better than it's published spec.
customer_reviews.author: EWF

customer_reviews.title: Quietness
customer_reviews.text: Greatly helped with keeping my server cooler and lowered the sound produced by my server.
customer_reviews.author: chris g

customer_reviews.title: LOUDEST FAN EVER
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed with this fan. It's super loud. I installed it in my Dell Optiplex and it's louder than my stock CPU fan, Case Fan and 120mm front case fan altogether!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M.

customer_reviews.title: Top-Notch Fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan is performing as expected; it is virtually silent. Lots of cheaper options out there, but you get what you pay. I have purchased several Noctua fans and cpu coolers, and am happy with all of them. No failures or other issue to date, and they are all whisper quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How cool is that
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet fans. Bought two of these to just to provide a little circulation in the bottom chamber of my Cooler Master HAF XB EVO (yeah...probably overkill since most of the heat generating components are in the upper chamber....but figured "what the heck" since I was populating the other fans with Noctua's). Anyway, when I first powered the system on I had to visually inspect the fans to make sure they were spinning because they were so quiet. How cool is that... (horrible pun)
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Super Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace fans in a video monitoring station and it is so quiet now and temps are fine. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron C. Doty

customer_reviews.title: Just a great set of fans that really do the job
customer_reviews.text: Just a great set of fans that really do the job. PWM fans can be controlled with the motherboard and have near silent operation at maximum power. The Fans are just built great and keep the system more than cool. I would highly recommend them. They come with splitters so you can add more than one of these to one fan header. Just be aware the splitter only measures the RPM of one fan and inputs voltage into both.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: super quiet
customer_reviews.text: its so quiet its "shocking" not to hear any fan case noise when the PC is on, I thought it wasn't running but looked at the fans with a flashlight, and they spin, but are silent, good quality, really improves PC time with a quiet background
customer_reviews.author: DVD Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great fans for a price
customer_reviews.text: Second to none for quiet and cool, but more expensive than most.. worth it for me but some may not agree.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably quiet
customer_reviews.text: The fan is very quiet. Now, I can't even tell that my PC is running!
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: Used these fans to replace the factory fans in my Inuke 6000dsp amp. These fans are so much more quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Jman

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, expensive
customer_reviews.text: Very pretty package. Very quiet. Expensive, but nice mounting options. Doesn't blow much air, but what do you expect from a 1400 rpm fan. I took a point off because of its cost.
customer_reviews.author: Crash

customer_reviews.title: Quiet cooling.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the 80mm fan on the back of my 12 drive cage. The computer is silent again.
customer_reviews.author: macs_forever

customer_reviews.title: Best fan ever
customer_reviews.text: Several installation options. Includes extender cable, Y splitter and rpm reducer. Very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Sava

customer_reviews.title: They're the best of the best.  Absolutely silent.
customer_reviews.text: I'm stunned at their ability to cool a 160mm radiator.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Four Thumbs

customer_reviews.title: Noctua has never let me down.
customer_reviews.text: On a motherboard with good automatic speed control, this fan is nearly completely silent in normal operation.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Pace

customer_reviews.title: Noctua NF-A8 PWM Premium 80mm Fan
customer_reviews.text: Added two to my Silverstone SG12B case for exhaust. Very quiet, very good fans.
customer_reviews.author: Erik J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Tested them out of the box, very quite. Have not installed them in their final location yet. Plan to use them with a thermally controlled PWM control board to cool condenser in my motor home refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: wnmorris

customer_reviews.title: Well the fan is amazing queit despite its high rpms i originally purchased it ...
customer_reviews.text: Well the fan is amazing queit despite its high rpms i originally purchased it to replace an old heatsink fan but i was off on the dimensions my fault but otherwise i still use this fan in all its glory o.O
customer_reviews.author: Vazrin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: High quality, and super-quiet. I added this fan to my office machine to increase ventilation. You wouldn't even know it was there (by the sound of it). It's pretty clear why people hold Noctura in the highest regard when it comes to cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron P. Mulhollen

customer_reviews.title: Good Noctua quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought several of these. Used them as case fans and also to replace two powersupply fans on older Antec Basique 500w. Quiet reliable fans, working for few years already without an issue. Using the provided resistors makes them even quieter. Will not consider other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: My Fan of Choice.
customer_reviews.text: Best fan manufacturer I've found. I've experienced fan failures and excessively noisy fans over the years, but never from a Noctua. I use them in all my computer cases anywhere a fan will fit, and my first Noctua CPU fan/heat sink combo (NH-C14 on a 1st generation I7 processor) is phenomenal. A perfect compliment for an SSD, you may have to look twice to see if the PC is on!
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

product_meta.title: Noctua NF-A8 PWM, Premium Quiet Fan, 4-Pin (80mm, Brown)
feature_bullets: Premium quiet fan, 80x80x25 mm, 12V, 4-pin PWM, max. 2200 RPM, max. 17.7 dB(A), >150,000 h MTTF
Award-winning 80x25mm A-series fan with Flow Acceleration Channels and Advanced Acoustic Optimisation frame for superior quiet cooling performance
8cm format is ideal for compact PC cases (HTPC, ITX, Small Form Factor) and other chassis (intake & exhaust), replacement fan for NAS and other devices, etc.
4-pin PWM version for automatic speed control via 4-pin PWM fan headers, broad 450-2200rpm speed range (1750rpm max. with supplied Low-Noise Adaptor)
Includes anti-vibration mounts, fan screws, Low-Noise Adaptor, extension cable and y-cable for running two PWM fans on the same header

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars445 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
